db8b7f02-62d5-4dbc-9573-22d653b97f6f.description: BSA Verafirm Certified SAM Professionals have demonstrated their mastery of the ISO 19770-1:2017 ITAM standard and know how to apply the management principles of the standard to establish, manage, and improve software asset management (SAM) systems in organizations of any size or industry. They understand the Plan-Do-Check-Act (PDCA) cycle of continuous improvement and the 15 processes required to establish a SAM system that consistently delivers results, maintains compliance and mitigates risks
db8b7f02-62d5-4dbc-9573-22d653b97f6f.name: Certified Software Asset Management Professional

issuer.summary: issued by BSA | The Software Alliance

alignments.name: ISO/IEC 19770-1: 2017
alignments.description: Published by the International Organization for Standardization (ISO) in 2017, ISO/IEC 19770-1:2017 is a management standard that specifies the requirements for an IT asset management system. It is the only ISO standard that extends the management principles of the Plan-Do-Check-Act method to IT asset management, including software.

badge_template_activities.title: BSA Verafirm Certified SAM Professionals complete the BSA Verafirm online course which incorporates approximately 12-15 hours of interactive, self-paced learning.  The course has detailed explanation of how to apply the ISO 19770-1:2017 ITAM standard to the management of software assets using case studies, knowledge checks, and practical templates.
To qualify for the certification, BSA Verafirm Certified SAM Professionals must have successfully completed the final assessment which is administered online.
